pr_title: Optimize LevenshteinDistance used in Fuzzy predicates

timeline.author: porunov

timeline.message:
Optimize LevenshteinDistance used in Fuzzy predicates

This reduces time complexity of fuzzy match from O(n^2) to O(n), where n
is the length of the shorter string. This also adds tests which use fuzzy
predicates without index.

Closes #2164

Signed-off-by: Boxuan Li <liboxuan@connect.hku.hk>

timeline.bodyText:
Just thinking. Won't it be a little bit more efficient if we would use return value.equals(term); here?
As I understand LevenshteinDistance is 0 only for equal strings, if I am not missing anything.
timeline.author: porunov

replies.bodyText: Ouch, why didn't I think about this in the first place... I think you are right. I'll update it later today.
replies.author: li-boxuan
